caption.title: Replication of ZIKV in Ae. aegypti on different days following exposure to an infectious blood meal.
caption.p: The titer in TCID 50 equivalents/mL of ZIKV in the bodies (A), legs+wings (B) and saliva (C) of Ae. aegypti and tested on different days after ingesting an infectious blood meal containing 10 6.7Â± 0.2 TCID 50/mL of ZIKV. Each point on the plot represents an individual mosquito, and bars denote medians. Solid lines represent significant differences P < 0.001 (**) between days for legs+wings and saliva titers. The horizontal dashed lines on days 10 and 14 represent the threshold titer above which virus transmission occurred.
